item.title: courses
item.description: The Bloomberg Center enrolled I spend most of my time on research – here are a few courses I took along the way in grad school: CS 5785: Applied Machine Learning, with Prof. Serge Belongie CS 6431: Security and Privacy Technologies, with Prof. Vitaly Shmatikov and Prof. Tom Ristenpart CS 6110: Advanced Programming Languages, with Prof. Adrian Sampson CS 6820: Analysis of Algorithms, with Prof.

item.title: research
item.description: Interests My research interests include topics in computer security & privacy, applied cryptography, fairness and accountability in machine learning, and interdisciplinary efforts among these areas. I currently work on computer security and privacy issues in the context of intimate partner violence (IPV), as part of a multi-institutional research team. Some research topics I’ve explored in depth include those listed in Cornell CS 6431: Security & Privacy Technologies. Publications R.
